posts._title: Oleg Teptsov – Gospodin oformitel AKA Mister Designer (1987)
posts.title: Gospodin oformitel
posts.excerpt: In this surreal take on Pygmalion set in 1900s St. Petersburg, Russia, a time known in art as Russian Decadence, a famous artist and decorator, Platon Andreevich, strives to find the secret to eternal life through the beautiful mannequins he creates, and his latest masterpiece, more perfect in his hubristic mind than anything that God …

posts.title: Eldorado XXI
posts.excerpt: Set in the highest settlement in the world, La Rinconada y Cerro Lunar (5500m), in the Peruvian Andes. Moved by the same interests as in the ancient times, people live and work in the most precarious of conditions. An illusion of gold and a better life leads men to self destruction.

posts._title: Andrea Bianchi & Jesús Franco – Commando Mengele AKA Angel of Death (1987)
posts.title: Commando Mengele
posts.excerpt: A Jewish commando unit hunting Nazi war criminals tracks down the infamous Dr. Mengele in the jungle, and find that he is torturing nubile young virgins and performing horrible medical experiments on the locals. They prepare to battle their way past Mengele’s hordes of fanatic Nazi bodyguards in order to get to him.

posts._title: Various – Deutschland 09 – 13 kurze Filme zur Lage der Nation AKA Germany 09: 13 Short Films About the State of the Nation (2009)
posts.title: Deutschland 09 – 13 kurze Filme zur Lage der Nation
posts.excerpt: Quote:Thirteen noted German filmmakers offer their impressions of the past, present and future of the land they call home in this anthology. Coordinated by Tom Tykwer, Deutschland 09, 13 kurze Filme zur Lage der Nation is comprised of thirteen twelve-minute films, each from a different director and each focusing on an individual aspect of Germany’s …
posts.titleEnglish: Germany 09: 13 Short Films About the State of the Nation

posts._title: Harun Farocki – Das doppelte Gesicht: Peter Lorre aka The Double Face of Peter Lorre (1984)
posts.title: Das doppelte Gesicht: Peter Lorre
posts.excerpt: Arnold Hohmann wrote:Peter Lorre achieved international fame for his performance in the myth-making role in M. This character has held a peculiar fascination for generations of cinephiles. However, at the time, whilst such success meant recognition, it also weighed on the Hungarian actor as a constrictive burden. Using photographs and film extracts, Das doppelte Gesicht …
posts.titleEnglish: The Double Face of Peter Lorre

posts.title: Cook Fuck Kill
posts.excerpt: Jaroslav K. seems to be a good son, father, and a decent husband. In reality, he is pathologically jealous of his beautiful wife Blanka, and his biggest nightmare is that she and their three kids might leave him one day. Jaroslav K. and his family do not shy away from violence and cheating, which eventually …

posts.title: Das Gelübde
posts.excerpt: Clemens Brentano, an artist in his prime, no longer wants to be an artist. The poet and bon vivant goes to the bedside of the nun Anna Katharina Emmerich as a simple “scribe of God’s wonders” to write down her visions and views. Emmerich became famous for her stigmata of Christ, which appeared on her …

posts.title: Kings Row
posts.excerpt: SynopsisFive children in an apparently ideal American small town find their lives changing as the years pass near the turn of the century in 1900. Parris and Drake, both of whom have lost their parents, are best friends; Parris dreams of becoming a doctor, studying under the father of his sweetheart Cassie, while Drake plans …
